item.title: NetDooka Framework Distributed via PrivateLoader Malware as Part of Pay-Per-Install Service
item.description: This report focuses on the components and infection chain ⁠of the NetDooka framework. Its scope ranges from the release of the first payload up until the release of the final RAT that is protected by a kernel driver.
item.dc:creator: Aliakbar Zahravi
Leandro Froes
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: AvosLocker Ransomware Variant Abuses Driver File to Disable Anti-Virus, Scans for Log4shell
item.description: We found an AvosLocker ransomware variant using a legitimate anti-virus component to disable detection and blocking solutions.
item.dc:creator: Christoper Ordonez
Alvin Nieto
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: New APT Group Earth Berberoka Targets Gambling Websites With Old and New Malware
item.description: We recently found a new advanced persistent threat (APT) group that we have dubbed Earth Berberoka (aka GamblingPuppet). This APT group targets gambling websites on Windows, macOS, and Linux platforms using old and new malware families.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Lunghi
Jaromir Horejsi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Trend Micro Partnering with Bit Discovery
item.description: We’re excited to partner with Bit Discovery, bringing attack surface discovery capabilities to the Trend Micro One platform, providing ongoing visibility to internal assets (devices, identities, applications) but also external, internet-facing assets.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: How to better manage your digital attack surface risk
item.description: As organizations shift to the cloud in droves, their digital attack surface continues to rapidly expand. And with the number of threats rapidly increasing, security leaders need to enhance their attack surface risk management. We explore how a unified cybersecurity platform can help improve your defenses against cyber risk in comparison to point products.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Analyzing Attempts to Exploit the Spring4Shell Vulnerability CVE-2022-22965 to Deploy Cryptocurrency Miners
item.description: Recently, we observed attempts to exploit the Spring4Shell vulnerability — a remote code execution bug, assigned as CVE-2022-22965 — by malicious actors to deploy cryptocurrency miners.
item.dc:creator: Nitesh Surana
Ashish Verma
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Critically Underrated: Studying the Data Distribution Service (DDS) Protocol
item.description: Researchers from Trend Micro Research, TXOne, ADLINK, Alias Robotics, and ZDI looked into the Data Distribution Service (DDS) standard and its implementations from a security angle. The full findings of this research will be presented in the S4X22 Conference in April 2022.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: An Investigation of the BlackCat Ransomware via Trend Micro Vision One
item.description: We recently investigated a case related to the BlackCat ransomware group using the Trend Micro Vision One™ platform, which comes with extended detection and response (XDR) capabilities. BlackCat (aka AlphaVM or AlphaV) is a ransomware family created in the Rust programming language and operated under a ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) model.
item.dc:creator: Lucas Silva
Leandro Froes
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Cyber Risk Index (2H’ 2021): An Assessment for Security Leaders
item.description: We take a look at our latest Cyber Risk Index (CRI) findings across North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, and Latin/South America, to help security leaders better understand, communicate, and address their enterprise’s cyber risk.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: CVE-2022-22965: Analyzing the Exploitation of Spring4Shell Vulnerability in Weaponizing and Executing the Mirai Botnet Malware
item.description: We discovered active exploitation of a vulnerability in the Spring Framework designated as CVE-2022-22965 that allows malicious actors to download the Mirai botnet malware.
item.dc:creator: Deep Patel
Nitesh Surana
Ashish Verma
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: TM Named CWS "Strong Performer" by Research Firm
item.description: Trend Micro was named a strong performer in the Forrester Wave™: Cloud Workload Security, Q1 2022, achieving the highest possible score in the market presence category. That said, Trend Micro Cloud One secures far more than workloads and containers.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: An In-Depth Look at ICS Vulnerabilities Part 3
item.description: In our series wrap-up, we look into CVEs that affect critical manufacturing based on MITRE’s matrix. We also explore common ICS-affecting vulnerabilities identified in 2021.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Detecting Exploitation of Local Vulnerabilities Through Trend Micro Vision One™ and Cloud One™
item.description: We provide a guide to detecting Dirty Pipe, a Linux kernel vulnerability tracked as CVE-2022-0847.
item.dc:creator: Sunil Bharti
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Thwarting Loaders: From SocGholish to BLISTER’s LockBit Payload
item.description: Both BLISTER and SocGholish are loaders known for their evasion tactics. Our report details what these loaders are capable of and our investigation into a campaign that uses both to deliver the LockBit ransomware.
item.dc:creator: Earle Maui Earnshaw
Mohamed Fahmy
Ian Kenefick
Ryan Maglaque
Abdelrhman Sharshar
Lucas Silva
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: An In-Depth Look at ICS Vulnerabilities Part 2
item.description: In part two of our three-part series, we continue to analyze vulnerabilities using MITRE ATT&CK. We also look into the sectors affected and their risk levels.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: MITRE Engenuity ATT&CK Tests
item.description: Trend Micro Vision One achieved a protection score of 100% in this year’s evaluation, proving once again that it is an invaluable tool that provides higher confidence detections for security operations teams.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: MacOS SUHelper Root Privilege Escalation Vulnerability: A Deep Dive Into CVE-2022-22639
item.description: We discovered a now-patched vulnerability in macOS SUHelper, designated as CVE-2022-22639. If exploited, the vulnerability could allow malicious actors to gain root privilege escalation.
item.dc:creator: Mickey Jin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - April 1, 2022
item.description: Probing the activities of cloud-based cryptocurrency-mining groups, and Lapsus$ ‘back from vacation’
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: An In-Depth Look at ICS Vulnerabilities Part 1
item.description: In this blog series our team examined various ICS vulnerabilities using the MITRE Adversarial Tactics, Techniques, and Common Knowledge (ATT&CK) for ICS.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Why Organizations Should Take Cloud-Based Cryptocurrency-Mining Attacks Seriously
item.description: One of the recent trends we’ve observed is the rise of cloud-based cryptocurrency-mining groups that exploit cloud resources, specifically the CPU power of deployed cloud instances, to mine cryptocurrency.
item.dc:creator: Mayra Rosario Fuentes
Stephen Hilt
Robert McArdle
Lord Alfred Remorin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - March 25, 2022
item.description: An investigation of cryptocurrency scams and schemes, and Lapsus$: Oxford teen accused of being multi-millionaire cyber-criminal
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Purple Fox Uses New Arrival Vector and Improves Malware Arsenal
item.description: Purple Fox is an old threat that has been making waves since 2018. This most recent investigation covers Purple Fox’s new arrival vector and early access loaders. Users’ machines seem to be targeted with malicious payloads masquerading as legitimate application installers.
item.dc:creator: Sherif Magdy
Abdelrhman Sharshar
Jay Yaneza
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: An Investigation of Cryptocurrency Scams and Schemes
item.description: We provide an overview of the diverse range of NFT- and cryptocurrency-related scams that malicious actors use to steal assets worldwide.
item.dc:creator: Cifer Fang
Vladimir Kropotov
Loseway Lu
Qi Sun
Fyodor Yarochkin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - March 18, 2022
item.description: Global Cyberattacks: Navigating New Frontiers: Trend Micro 2021 Annual Cybersecurity Report, and US Has 'Significant' Cyber Vulnerabilities, But A Sweeping Russian Cyberattack Is Unlikely
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Cyclops Blink Sets Sights on Asus Routers
item.description: This report discusses the technical capabilities of this Cyclops Blink malware variant that targets ASUS routers and includes a list of more than 150 current and historical command-and-control (C&C) servers of the Cyclops Blink botnet.
item.dc:creator: Feike Hacquebord
Stephen Hilt
Fernando Merces
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Oil/Gas Cybersecurity: Halt Critical Operation Attacks
item.description: Trend Micro has released a technical report on how the oil and gas industry can gain situational awareness across OT, IT and CT.
item.dc:creator: Kazuhisa Tagaya
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Utility Cybersecurity: Situational Awareness Cuts Risk
item.description: Trend Micro has released a technical report on how the electric utility industry can gain situational awareness across entire network.
item.dc:creator: Kazuhisa Tagaya
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Will Russian Oil Ban Spur Increased Cyber-Attacks
item.description: President Biden banned the sale of Russian oil to the United States to deprive the Putin regime of the economic resources needed to wage war. But this may put US companies in the firing line of cyber-attacks from the east.
item.dc:creator: Ed Cabrera
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: New Nokoyawa Ransomware Possibly Related to Hive
item.description: In March 2022, we came across evidence that another, relatively unknown, ransomware known as Nokoyawa is likely connected with Hive, as the two families share some striking similarities in their attack chain, from the tools used to the order in which they execute various steps.
item.dc:creator: Don Ovid Ladores
Ian Kenefick
Earle Maui Earnshaw
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: New RURansom Wiper Targets Russia
item.description: We analyze RURansom, a malware variant discovered to be targeting Russia. Originally suspected to be a ransomware because of its name, analysis reveals RURansom to be a wiper.
item.dc:creator: Jaromir Horejsi
Cedric Pernet
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News March 4, 2022
item.description: Global Cyberattacks: How to manage risk in times of chaos, and Ukraine-Russia cyber warzone splits cyber underground
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Cyberattacks are Prominent in the Russia-Ukraine Conflict
item.description: As Russia invaded Ukraine, our researchers have also observed a number of alleged cyberattacks perpetrated by different groups. Our research teams have verified and validated internal data and external reports to provide accurate information that can be used to strengthen defenses against these attacks. We will continuously update this blog with validated threats as more events unfold.
item.dc:creator: Trend Micro Research
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: SMS PVA Part 3: Countries Most Impacted by Service
item.description: In this final part, we discuss the countries most affected by SMS PVA services as well as lay out several recommendations to mitigate the risks of such threats.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: SMS PVA Part 2: Underground Service for Cybercriminals
item.description: In part two of this blog entry, we further investigate the innings of smspva.net and discuss the impact and implications of such services.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - February 25, 2022
item.description: Recent cyberattacks increasingly target open-source web servers, and US officials tell businesses to watch for potential ransomware attacks after Biden announces Russia sanctions
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Global Cyberattacks Tied to the Russian Invasion of Ukraine
item.description: Cyber-risk management and security fundamentals are the key to cyber-resilience. 5 best practices to manage your cyber risk.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Recent Cyberattacks Target Open-source Web Servers
item.description: Malicious actors take advantage of people’s reliance on web servers to perform attacks like remote code execution, access control bypass, denial of service, or even cyberjacking the victim servers to mine cryptocurrencies.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: SMS PVA Part 1: Underground Service for Cybercriminals
item.description: In this three-part blog entry, our team explored SMS PVA, a service built on top of a global bot network that compromises smartphone cybersecurity as we know it.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Latest Mac Coinminer Utilizes Open-Source Binaries and the I2P Network
item.description: A Mac coinminer has been spotted using open-source components in its routine and the I2P Network to hide its traffic. We dive into old iterations of this malware, and also analyze the newest version.
item.dc:creator: Luis Magisa
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - February 18, 2022
item.description: SMS PVA services' use of infected Android phones reveals flaws in SMS verification, and 'Russian state-sponsored cyber actors' cited in hacks of U.S. defense contractors
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Ukraine Cyberattack 2022: Geopolitical Cybersecurity
item.description: As geopolitical tensions rise, so does pressure to enhance corporate cyber-resilience
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: SMS PVA Services' Use of Infected Android Phones Reveals Flaws in SMS Verification
item.description: Certain SMS PVA services allow their customers to create disposable user profiles or register multiple accounts on many popular online platforms. These services can be abused by criminals to conduct fraud or other malicious activities.
item.dc:creator: Zhengyu Dong
Ryan Flores
Vladimir Kropotov
Paul Pajares
Fyodor Yarochkin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Security Automation with Vision One & Palo Alto
item.description: Trend Micro Vision One™ integrates with Palo Alto Networks Cortex™ XSOAR to drive automated response to incidents uncovered by Vision One.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - February 11, 2022
item.description: Hidden scams in malicious scans, and feds arrest couple who allegedly laundered $1 Billion in stolen bitcoins
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Detecting PwnKit (CVE-2021-4034) Using Trend Micro™ Vision One™ and Cloud One™
item.description: This blog discusses how CVE-2021-4034 can be detected and blocked using Trend Micro™ Vision One™ and Trend Micro Cloud One™.
item.dc:creator: Sunil Bharti
Nitesh Surana
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - February 4, 2022
item.description: Welcome to our weekly roundup, where we share what you need to know about cybersecurity news and events that happened over the past few days. Learn about the Samba vulnerability discovered by Trend Micro the White House’s warning of Russian hacks as tensions with Ukraine grow.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Why Cyber Change Outpaces Boardroom Engagement
item.description: Organizations must avoid the mistakes of the past and build a security-by-design culture that permeates enterprise-wide.
item.dc:creator: Bharat Mistry
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Codex Exposed: Helping Hackers in Training?
item.description: How useful is the Codex code generator as a potential training tool?
item.dc:creator: Forward-Looking Threat Research Team
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: The Samba Vulnerability: What is CVE-2021-44142 and How to Fix It
item.description: Information on the latest Samba vulnerability and how to protect systems against the threats that can exploit it.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - January 28th, 2022
item.description: Welcome to our weekly roundup, where we share what you need to know about cybersecurity news and events that happened over the past few days. This week, read the third installment of Trend Micro’s Codex series. Also, read about the White House’s latest zero-trust approach to its cybersecurity strategy.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Defending the Supply Chain: Why the DDS Protocol is Critical in Industrial and Software Systems
item.description: In 2021, a team of researchers from Trend Micro Research, TXOne, ADLINK, Alias Robotics, and ZDI looked into the Data Distribution Service (DDS) standard and its implementations from a security angle. The full findings of this research will be presented in the S4X22 Conference in April 2022.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: TianySpy Malware Uses Smishing Disguised as Message From Telco
item.description: Trend Micro confirmed a new mobile malware infection chain targeting both Android and iPhone devices. The malware might have been designed to steal credentials associated with membership websites of major Japanese telecommunication services.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Analysis and Impact of LockBit Ransomware’s First Linux and VMware ESXi Variant
item.description: LockBit ransomware's operators announced the release of its first Linux and ESXi variant in October. With samples also spotted in the wild, we discuss the impact and analysis of this variant.
item.dc:creator: Junestherry Dela Cruz
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Investigating APT36 or Earth Karkaddan’s Attack Chain and Malware Arsenal
item.description: We investigated the most recent activities of APT36, also known as Earth Karkaddan, a politically motivated advanced persistent threat (APT) group, and discuss its use of CapraRAT, an Android RAT with clear similarities in design to the group’s favored Windows malware, Crimson RAT.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - January 21, 2022
item.description: This week, read about various cybersecurity threats that affect industrial control and the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA)’s latest cyberattack warnings.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Emotet Spam Abuses Unconventional IP Address Formats to Spread Malware
item.description: We found waves of Emotet spam campaigns using unconventional IP addresses to evade detection.
item.dc:creator: Ian Kenefick
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Codex Exposed: Task Automation and Response Consistency
item.description: Being able to automate tasks or programmatically execute them unsupervised is an essential part of both regular and malicious computer usage, so we wondered if a tool like Codex was reliable enough to be scripted and left to run unsupervised, generating the required code.
item.dc:creator: Forward-Looking Threat Research Team
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Defending Users’ NAS Devices From Evolving Threats
item.description: In our latest research, we analyze the threats targeting well-known brands of network-attached storage (NAS) devices.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Hilt
Fernando Merces
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Cybersecurity for Industrial Control Systems: Part 2
item.description: To cap off the series, we’ll discuss malware detection and distribution in various countries. Our team also rounds up several insights to help strengthen ICS cybersecurity and mitigate malware attacks.
item.dc:creator: Ericka Pingol
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: New Ransomware Spotted: White Rabbit and Its Evasion Tactics
item.description: We analyze the ransomware White Rabbit and bring into focus the familiar evasion tactics employed by this newcomer.
item.dc:creator: Arianne Dela Cruz
Bren Matthew Ebriega
Don Ovid Ladores
Mary Yambao
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Earth Lusca Employs Sophisticated Infrastructure, Varied Tools and Techniques
item.description: Our technical brief provides an in-depth look at Earth Lusca’s activities, the tools it employs in attacks, and the infrastructure it uses.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Cybersecurity for Industrial Control Systems: Part 1
item.description: In this two-part series, we look into various cybersecurity threats that affected industrial control systems endpoints. We also discuss several insights and recommendations to mitigate such threats.
item.dc:creator: Trend Micro Research
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - January 14, 2022
item.description: This week, read about how crucial it is for security teams to adopt an integrated approach to threat detection, such as remote control, and Congress’s plan to update the Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA) for the first time in eight years.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Analyzing an Old Bug and Discovering CVE-2021-30995
item.description: A vulnerability found in 2021 has been patched and re-patched in the months since it was reported. We analyze the bug and outline the process that led to the discovery of CVE-2021-30995.
item.dc:creator: Mickey Jin
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Codex Exposed: How Low Is Too Low When We Generate Code?
item.description: In a series of blog posts, we explore different aspects of Codex and assess its capabilities with a focus on the security aspects that affect not only regular developers but also malicious users. This is the second part of the series.
item.dc:creator: Forward-Looking Threat Research Team
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: LoRaWAN's Protocol Stacks: The Forgotten Targets at Risk
item.description: This report is the fourth part of our LoRaWAN security series, and highlights an attack vector that, so far, has not attracted much attention: the LoRaWAN stack. The stack is the root of LoRaWAN implementation and security. We hope to help users secure it and make LoRaWAN communication resistant to critical bugs.
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Dudek
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Uncovering and Defending Systems Against Attacks With Layers of Remote Control
item.description: The Trend Micro™ Managed XDR team addressed a stealthy multilayered attack that progressed from an exploited endpoint vulnerability to the use of legitimate remote access tools including Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) as its final means of intrusion.
item.dc:creator: Abraham Camba
Gilbert Sison
Ryan Maglaque
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - January 7, 2022
item.description: This week, read about Log4j vulnerabilities in connected cars and charging stations and how iOS malware can fake iPhone shutdowns to snoop on cameras and microphones.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Codex Exposed: Exploring the Capabilities and Risks of OpenAI’s Code Generator
item.description: The first of a series of blog posts examines the security risks of Codex, a code generator powered by the GPT-3 engine.
item.dc:creator: Forward-Looking Threat Research Team
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Examining Log4j Vulnerabilities in Connected Cars and Charging Stations
item.description: In this entry we look into how Log4j vulnerabilities affect devices or properties embedded in or used for connected cars, specifically chargers, in-vehicle infotainment systems, and digital remotes for opening cars.
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Dudek
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: The Log4j story, and how it has impacted our customers
item.description: Read about the Log4j story, an analysis of the impact and what to do next.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: What to Do About Log4j
item.description: Learn more about some tactical measures people are already taking, and some strategic guidance for what to do after the immediate crisis abates.
item.dc:creator: William Malik
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Are Endpoints at Risk for Log4Shell Attacks?
item.description: We created a free assessment tool for scanning devices to know whether it is at risk for Log4Shell attacks.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - December 17, 2021
item.description: This week, read on Purple Fox’s infection chain observed by Trend Micro’s Managed XDR. Also, learn about the Log4j vulnerability that has the potential to cause ‘incalculable’ damage.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Staging a Quack: Reverse Analyzing a Fileless QAKBOT Stager
item.description: We analyzed a fileless QAKBOT stager possibly connected to the recently reported Squirrelwaffle campaign.
item.dc:creator: Abraham Camba
Jonna Santos
Gilbert Sison
Jay Yaneza
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Volatile and Adaptable: Tracking the Movements of Modern Ransomware
item.description: Trend Micro's tracking of modern ransomware, as well as of older families, shows which attacks are gaining momentum and which families are particularly dangerous for enterprises and private users.
item.dc:creator: Trend Micro Research
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Collecting In the Dark: Tropic Trooper Targets Transportation and Government
item.description: Our long-term monitoring of the cyberespionage group Earth Centaur (aka Tropic Trooper) shows that the threat actors are equipped with new tools and techniques. The group seems to be targeting transportation companies and government agencies related to transportation.
item.dc:creator: Nick Dai
Ted Lee
Vickie Su
item.category: Trend Micro Research : APT & Targeted Attacks
Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: A Look Into Purple Fox’s Server Infrastructure
item.description: By examining Purple Fox’s routines and activities, both with our initial research and the subject matter we cover in this blog post, we hope to help incident responders, security operation centers (SOCs), and security researchers find and weed out Purple Fox infections in their network.
item.dc:creator: Jay Yaneza
Abdelrhman Sharshar
Sherif Magdy
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Patch Now: Apache Log4j Vulnerability Called Log4Shell Actively Exploited
item.description: Log4Shell, also known as CVE-2021-44228, was first reported privately to Apache on November 24 and was patched on December 9. It affects Apache Struts, Apache Solr, Apache Druid, Elasticsearch, Apache Dubbo, and VMware vCenter.
item.dc:creator: Ranga Duraisamy
Ashish Verma
Miguel Carlo Ang
Nitesh Surana
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - December 10, 2021
item.description: This week, read about Trend Micro’s predictions for security in the coming year. Also, learn about the Biden administration’s latest initiatives for curtailing attacks on the transport infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: New Yanluowang Ransomware Found to be Code-Signed, Terminates Database-Related Processes
item.description: We analyzed new samples of the Yanluowang ransomware. One interesting aspect of these samples is that the files are code-signed. They also terminate various processes which are related to database and backup management.
item.dc:creator: Don Ovid Ladores
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: The Evolution of IoT Linux Malware Based on MITRE ATT&CK TTPs
item.description: In our study, we relied on the tactics, techniques, and procedures of MITRE ATT&CK to define the malware capabilities and characteristics of IoT Linux malware. We describe our findings and how IoT malware has been evolving.
item.dc:creator: Veronica Chierzi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Pushing Forward: Key Takeaways From Trend Micro’s Security Predictions for 2022
item.description: In this entry, we discuss several of our predictions that security professionals and decision-makers should know about to help them make informed decisions on various security fronts in the coming year.

item.title: This Week in Security News - December 3, 2021
item.description: This week, learn about how Squirrelwaffle utilized ProxyLogon and ProxyShell to hack email chains. Also, read on a recent data breach of the Los Angeles Planned Parenthood Network.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Vulnerabilities Exploited for Monero Mining Malware Delivered via GitHub, Netlify
item.description: We looked into exploitation attempts we observed in the wild and the abuse of legitimate platforms Netlify and GitHub as repositories for malware.
item.dc:creator: Nitesh Surana
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: What to do at AWS re:Invent 2021 - Day 3
item.description: Welcome to your complete guide to AWS re:Invent 2021 Day 3, where you will find tips on how to get the most out of your conference experience both in Las Vegas and virtually.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Analyzing How TeamTNT Used Compromised Docker Hub Accounts
item.description: Following our previous disclosure of compromised Docker hub accounts delivering cryptocurrency miners, we analyze these accounts and discover more malicious actions that you need to be aware of.
item.dc:creator: Trend Micro Research
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: What You Can Do to Mitigate Cloud Misconfigurations
item.description: Cloud misconfigurations can become opportunities for cyberattacks or lead to data breaches. Organizations must mitigate them before incurring significant and costly consequences.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Ansari
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Trend Micro Cloud One Network Security-as-a-Service
item.description: Trend Micro, alongside Amazon Web Services, provides the latest in cloud-native deployment options. We have simplified network security, protecting customers across Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs) without needing agents to be installed on instances.
item.dc:creator: Laura Roantree
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: AWS re:Invent 2021 Guide: Checklist & Key Sessions
item.description: Welcome to your complete guide to AWS re:Invent 2021, where you will find tips on how to get the most out of your conference experience both in Las Vegas and virtually.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Ansari
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Campaign Abusing Legitimate Remote Administrator Tools Uses Fake Cryptocurrency Websites
item.description: We have been tracking a campaign involving the SpyAgent malware that abuses well-known remote access tools (RATs) for some time now. While previous versions of the malware have been covered by other researchers, our blog entry focuses on the malicious actor’s latest attacks.
item.dc:creator: Jaromir Horejsi
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: BazarLoader Adds Compromised Installers, ISO to Arrival and Delivery Vectors
item.description: We observed BazarLoader adding two new arrival mechanisms to their current roster of malware delivery techniques.
item.dc:creator: Ian Kenefick
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: COP26 Backs Electric Vehicles to Reduce Climate Change
item.description: The 26 United Nations Climate Change Conference pushes for countries of parties to adopt more widespread EV use in order to reduce the looming threats of climate change.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: This Week in Security News - November 19, 2021
item.description: This week, learn about how the QAKBOT Loader malware has evolved its techniques and strategies over time. Also, read about the most recent initiative by the legislation to further cybersecurity protection.
item.dc:creator: Jon Clay
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Squirrelwaffle Exploits ProxyShell and ProxyLogon to Hijack Email Chains
item.description: Squirrelwaffle is known for using the tactic of sending malicious spam as replies to existing email chains. We look into how by investigating its exploit of Microsoft Exchange Server vulnerabilities, ProxyLogon and ProxyShell.
item.dc:creator: Mohamed Fahmy
Sherif Magdy
Abdelrhman Sharshar
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Analyzing ProxyShell-related Incidents via Trend Micro Managed XDR
item.description: In this blog entry, we will take a look at the ProxyShell vulnerabilities that were being exploited in these events, and dive deeper into the notable post-exploitation routines that were used in four separate incidents involving these web shell attacks.
item.dc:creator: Mohamed Fahmy
Abdelrhman Sharshar
Sherif Magdy
Ryan Maglaque

item.title: Post-pandemic growth starts with understanding risk
item.description: The digital transformations that accompanied the pandemic are here to stay. To succeed in the post-pandemic era, organizations must come to a shared understanding about cybersecurity as a critical element of business risk.
item.dc:creator: Bharat Mistry
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Global Operations Lead to Arrests of Alleged Members of GandCrab/REvil and Cl0p Cartels
item.description: A total of 13 suspects believed to be members of two prolific cybercrime rings were arrested as a global coalition across five continents involving law enforcement and private partners, including Trend Micro, sought to crack down on big ransomware operators.
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: Groups Target Alibaba ECS Instances for Cryptojacking
item.description: We looked at how some malicious groups disable features in Alibaba Cloud ECS instances for illicit mining of Monero.
item.dc:creator: David Fiser
Alfredo Oliveira
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports

item.title: QAKBOT Loader Returns With New Techniques and Tools
item.description: QAKBOT operators resumed email spam operations towards the end of September after an almost three-month hiatus. QAKBOT detection has become a precursor to many critical and widespread ransomware attacks. Our report shares some insight into the new techniques and tools this threat is using.
item.dc:creator: Ian Kenefick
Vladimir Kropotov
item.category: Trend Micro Research : Articles, News, Reports
